DataElement.preferredDefinition: The method used to determine disease response.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tumor Identifier Domain Progressive Disease Evaluation Method
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A domain that represents the data that uniquely identifies tumors._A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity._A description of the technique for the appraisal of a subject or object.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A domain that represents the data that uniquely identifies tumors.

Concepts.definition: A domain that represents the data that uniquely identifies tumors.

Property.preferredDefinition: A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity.:A description of the technique for the appraisal of a subject or object.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.
A description of the technique for the appraisal of a subject or object.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Released. AK 2020-6-10; Created for CDSIC aligned NCI Standard CRFs. ghd

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may refer to eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression._Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria._A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any one of several evaluation/assessment tools used to ascertain a patient's condition or diagnosis.

Concepts.definition: Any evaluation or assessment tool used to ascertain a patient's condition or diagnosis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Techniques for studying or analyzing the genetic composition and mechanisms of living organisms at the molecular level. May refer to the understanding and manipulation of genes (DNA).

Concepts.definition: A laboratory procedure that involves the study of tissues, cells, and fluids using DNA/RNA analysis techniques for the identification of characteristics and abnormalities at the molecular level.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Laboratory technique involving interaction of antigens with specific antibodies.

Concepts.definition: Laboratory test involving interaction of antigens with specific antibodies.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.

Concepts.definition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Techniques for analysis of chromosomal and subchromosomal properties and structures, such as those to diagnose, classify, screen for, or manage genetic diseases and abnormalities.

Concepts.definition: Techniques for analysis of chromosomal and subchromosomal properties and structures, such as those to diagnose, classify, screen for, or manage genetic diseases and abnormalities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Measurable and quantifiable biological parameters (e.g., specific enzyme concentration, specific hormone concentration, specific gene phenotype distribution in a population, presence of biological substances) which serve as indices for health- and physiology-related assessments, such as disease risk, psychiatric disorders, environmental exposure and its effects, disease diagnosis, metabolic processes, substance abuse, pregnancy, cell line development, epidemiologic studies, etc

Concepts.definition: A characteristic that can be objectively measured and serves as an indicator for normal biologic processes, pathogenic processes, state of health or disease, the risk for disease development and/or prognosis, or responsiveness to a particular therapeutic intervention.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A light microscopic finding that describes the cellular characteristics and architectural patterns of cell populations in a tissue sample.

Concepts.definition: A light microscopic finding that describes the cellular characteristics and architectural patterns of cell populations in a tissue sample.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.: Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may refer to eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.:Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.:A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.
Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.
A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueDomain.origin: NCISTD: NCI CRF Harmonization and Standards Initiative
ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created for CRF Harmonization per request by Response WG. mc 8/13/13

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDISC Aligned NCI Standard Equivalent CDE
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is to be used for CDISC aligned data collection in place of CDE 3855560 from the original NCI Standard CRF Template.

ReferenceDocuments.description: What was the method used to determine progression or recurrence?
